# DockAccessory.FramingMode

**Enumeration**

The mode to control framing of the subject when tracking.

## Declaration

```swift
enum FramingMode
```

## Overview

The default is [doc://com.apple.DockKit/documentation/DockKit/DockAccessory/FramingMode-swift.enum/automatic], which works well for most situations. [doc://com.apple.DockKit/documentation/DockKit/DockAccessory/FramingMode-swift.enum/center] keeps the subject close to the middle of frame. Similarly, [doc://com.apple.DockKit/documentation/DockKit/DockAccessory/FramingMode-swift.enum/left] and [doc://com.apple.DockKit/documentation/DockKit/DockAccessory/FramingMode-swift.enum/right] aligns the subject close to the left and right third of the frame (left, center, right).

## Defining the framing mode

- **DockAccessory.FramingMode.automatic**: Automatically frame the subject.
- **DockAccessory.FramingMode.center**: Frame the subject in the center of the frame.
- **DockAccessory.FramingMode.left**: Frame the subject in the left side of the frame.
- **DockAccessory.FramingMode.right**: Frame the subject in the right side of the frame.

## Setting framing mode

- **setFramingMode(_:)**: Customize the dock accessory’s tracking behavior.
- **framingMode**: The current framing mode.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
